intro: Microlicia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves that can be either simple or lobed depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Microlicia heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
